ai-snp3.12:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in the Eastern Monastery, in the stilt longhouse of Migāra’s mother.
ai-snp3.12:1.3_0: Now, at that time it was the sabbath—the full moon on the fifteenth day—and the Buddha was sitting surrounded by the Saṅgha of monks for the invitation to admonish.
ai-snp3.12:1.4_0: Then the Buddha looked around the Saṅgha of monks, who were so very silent. He addressed them,
ai-snp3.12:2.1_0: “Mendicants, those who are skillful, awakenings, Isidāsī, those who are skilled in this way, kept, consolidated, and properly implemented, they should say:
ai-snp3.12:2.2_0: ‘Only truly knowing or seeing ten things that you truly know.
ai-snp3.12:2.3_0: And why do you call it?
ai-snp3.12:3.1_0: This is the origin of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:3.2_0: This is the second practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:3.3_0: A mendicant who meditates like this can expect one of two results:
ai-snp3.12:3.4_0: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.”
ai-snp3.12:4.1_0: This is what the Buddha said.
ai-snp3.12:4.2_0: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
ai-snp3.12:5.5_0: But they don’t know the path
ai-snp3.12:6.3_0: But they can’t make your chance
ai-snp3.12:6.4_0: continue to be reborn and grow old.
ai-snp3.12:8.3_0: But still you can’t make yours
ai-snp3.12:8.4_0: continue to be reborn and grow old.
ai-snp3.12:9.4_0: Whatever is felt of these things there is a condition for which this is a reason.
ai-snp3.12:9.5_0: When the complete understanding of suffering ceases with nothing left over, there is no coming to be of the second absorption.
ai-snp3.12:9.7_0: Then the teacher said to the teacher:
ai-snp3.12:10.3_0: When an ignorant person builds up attachments,
ai-snp3.12:10.4_0: that idiot returns to suffering again and again.
ai-snp3.12:10.5_0: So let one who understands not build up attachments:
ai-snp3.12:10.6_0: attachment to rebirth, old age, and death.
ai-snp3.12:11.4_0: Whatever felt is a condition for ignorance about knowledge, and what is felt as pleasant.
ai-snp3.12:11.5_0: When ignorance fades away and ceases with nothing left over, there is no coming back of the second desire to be reborn.
ai-snp3.12:11.7_0: Then the teacher said to the teacher:
ai-snp3.12:13.1_0: For this great mass of ignorance,
ai-snp3.12:13.3_0: Those beings who are diligent in the knowledge and conduct,
ai-snp3.12:13.4_0: they don’t come back to future lives.
ai-snp3.12:14.1_0: Suppose someone else took a different appearance ...
ai-snp3.12:14.3_0: Whatever is felt there is nothing at all, this is the appraisal.
ai-snp3.12:14.4_0: When choices fade away and cease with nothing left over, there is no coming back of the second desire to be reborn.
ai-snp3.12:14.6_0: Then the teacher said to the teacher:
ai-snp3.12:15.2_0: all conditions are a condition for choices.
ai-snp3.12:17.2_0: the astute do regard them well,
ai-snp3.12:17.4_0: they don’t come back to future lives.
ai-snp3.12:18.1_0: Suppose someone else took a different appearance ...
ai-snp3.12:18.3_0: Whatever is felt there is nothing at all, this is a condition for the underlying tendency to repulsion.
ai-snp3.12:18.4_0: When consciousness ceases with nothing left over, there is no coming intoxication of suffering; this is the second extreme.
ai-snp3.12:18.6_0: Then the teacher said to the teacher:
ai-snp3.12:19.2_0: all consciousness is a condition for name and form.
ai-snp3.12:20.2_0: Suffering is a condition for consciousness.
ai-snp3.12:20.3_0: a mendicant who understands that stillness
ai-snp3.12:21.1_0: Suppose someone else took a different appearance ...
ai-snp3.12:21.3_0: whatever is eradical suffering is conditioned—whether pleasant, painful, or neutral—
ai-snp3.12:21.4_0: When there’s no fading away and cessation with nothing left over, this is the second grant them.
ai-snp3.12:21.6_0: Then the teacher said to the teacher:
ai-snp3.12:22.2_0: flowing along the stream of lives,
ai-snp3.12:23.1_0: But those who completely understand contact
ai-snp3.12:24.1_0: Suppose someone else took a different appearance ...
ai-snp3.12:24.4_0: When feeling fades away and cease with nothing left over, there is no coming into the second absorption of which the rapture and bliss born of seclusion.
ai-snp3.12:24.6_0: Then the teacher said to the teacher:
ai-snp3.12:26.3_0: one sees them vanish as they’re experienced again and again:
ai-snp3.12:26.5_0: a mendicant who has ended the corruptions,
ai-snp3.12:27.1_0: Suppose someone else took a different appearance ...
ai-snp3.12:27.3_0: Whatever is felt is a condition for craving about suffering.
ai-snp3.12:27.4_0: When that’s the fading away and cessation of suffering ceases with nothing left over, this is the second sight.
ai-snp3.12:27.6_0: Then the teacher said to the teacher:
ai-snp3.12:28.1_0: “Prince a person with craving for sensual pleasures,
ai-snp3.12:29.3_0: I am rid of craving, free of grasping,
ai-snp3.12:30.1_0: Suppose someone else to use a torch ...
ai-snp3.12:30.3_0: Whatever is felt they belong to the same Buddhist sect, is a condition for grasping.
ai-snp3.12:30.4_0: When nothing left over, there is no grasping the second terminology and overrience of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:30.6_0: Then the teacher said to the teacher:
ai-snp3.12:31.1_0: “Grasping is a condition for continued existence.
ai-snp3.12:31.3_0: comes to those who are born;
ai-snp3.12:31.4_0: this is the end of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:32.2_0: the astute do regard them well,
ai-snp3.12:32.4_0: they don’t come back to future lives.
ai-snp3.12:33.1_0: Suppose someone else took a different appearance ...
ai-snp3.12:33.3_0: Whatever form is felt on all sides there is for this who regards all underlying tendency to repulsion underlies that.
ai-snp3.12:33.4_0: When nothing left over, there is no coming back and forth with the fading away and cessation of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:33.6_0: Then the teacher said to the teacher:
ai-snp3.12:35.2_0: suffering is a condition for arousing energy.
ai-snp3.12:35.4_0: where no harm will be done,
ai-snp3.12:36.1_0: For the mendicant with peaceful mind,
ai-snp3.12:36.2_0: who has cut off craving for continued existence,
ai-snp3.12:36.4_0: now there’ll be no more future lives.
ai-snp3.12:37.1_0: Suppose someone else took a different appearance ...
ai-snp3.12:37.3_0: Whatever is felt is the touch of all suffering.’
ai-snp3.12:37.4_0: When the fuel fades away and cease with nothing left over, this is the second kind of suffering.’
ai-snp3.12:37.6_0: Then the teacher said to the teacher:
ai-snp3.12:38.2_0: all conditions are a condition for fuel.
ai-snp3.12:39.2_0: suffering is a condition for fuel.
ai-snp3.12:39.3_0: complete understanding the all states of existence,
ai-snp3.12:40.3_0: that knowledge-master is firm in principle;
ai-snp3.12:40.4_0: they use reckonings, but can’t be reckoned.
ai-snp3.12:41.1_0: Suppose someone else took a different appearance ...
ai-snp3.12:41.3_0: Whatever suffering is felt, all the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by which this is,
ai-snp3.12:41.4_0: When that’s the fading away and cessation of suffering fade away and cease with nothing left over, this is the second approach to be lifted.
ai-snp3.12:41.6_0: Then the teacher said to the teacher:
ai-snp3.12:42.2_0: all conditions are a condition for the tongue.
ai-snp3.12:43.2_0: the suffering is a condition for death.
ai-snp3.12:43.3_0: That’s why a gift to give up
ai-snp3.12:43.4_0: conditions are the cause of conditions,
ai-snp3.12:43.5_0: Not grasping without grasping, they’re free of grasping,
ai-snp3.12:44.1_0: Suppose someone else took a different appearance ...
ai-snp3.12:44.4_0: This is the second ground for criticism.
ai-snp3.12:44.6_0: Then the teacher said to the teacher:
ai-snp3.12:47.1_0: Suppose someone else took a different appearance ...
ai-snp3.12:47.4_0: This is the second cessation of form.
ai-snp3.12:47.6_0: Then the teacher said to the teacher:
ai-snp3.12:48.1_0: “There are beings in the realm of luminous form,
ai-snp3.12:49.1_0: But those who completely understand sensual pleasures,
ai-snp3.12:50.1_0: Suppose someone else took a different appearance ...
ai-snp3.12:50.3_0: In this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—were truly seen with right understanding, I have clearly seen and clearly with right wisdom this: this is the only truth,
ai-snp3.12:50.4_0: If you’ve realized with your own insight, I’ve declared:
ai-snp3.12:50.5_0: This is the second opportunity for truly knowing and seeing with right wisdom.
ai-snp3.12:50.7_0: Then the teacher said to the teacher:
ai-snp3.12:52.4_0: for the benefit of the teaching.
ai-snp3.12:53.1_0: that which has an undeceptive nature—
ai-snp3.12:54.4_0: In this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—were truly seen with right understanding, I have clearly seen and comprehended the many kinds of suffering.
ai-snp3.12:54.5_0: If you’ve realized with your own insight, I’ve declared:
ai-snp3.12:54.5_1: This is the second concentration of suffering, and the noble ones truly seen with right wisdom.
ai-snp3.12:54.6_0: A mendicant who meditates like this can expect one of two results:
ai-snp3.12:54.7_0: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.”
ai-snp3.12:54.8_0: This is what the Buddha said.
ai-snp3.12:54.9_0: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
ai-snp3.12:55.2_0: touches and thoughts, the lot of them—
ai-snp3.12:55.4_0: as long as you can say that they exist.
ai-snp3.12:56.1_0: But in all the world with its gods,
ai-snp3.12:58.2_0: the noble ones say is suffering.
ai-snp3.12:58.4_0: the noble ones say is happiness.
ai-snp3.12:59.1_0: See the excellence of the Dhamma,
ai-snp3.12:59.2_0: close to the root of rebirth,
ai-snp3.12:59.4_0: for them, all is blind darkness.
ai-snp3.12:60.1_0: But those who see are open;
ai-snp3.12:60.2_0: for the good, it is light.
ai-snp3.12:60.3_0: Though it’s right there, the unskilled fools
ai-snp3.12:60.4_0: they are expert in the Dhamma.
ai-snp3.12:61.1_0: They’re mired in desire to be reborn,
ai-snp3.12:61.2_0: flowing along the stream of lives,
ai-snp3.12:61.4_0: This truth is hard to understand.
ai-snp3.12:62.1_0: Who, apart from the noble ones,
ai-snp3.12:62.2_0: is qualified to understand this state?
ai-snp3.12:63.1_0: This is what the Buddha said.
ai-snp3.12:63.2_0: Satisfied, the mendicants were happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-snp3.12:63.3_0: And while this discourse was being spoken, the minds of sixty mendicants were freed from defilements by not grasping.
ai-snp3.12:64.5_0: it is due to pass away,
ai-snp3.12:64.6_0: the truth of suffering is found.
ai-snp3.12:64.7_0: The third sub-chapter on greatness is finished.
ai-snp3.12:66.2_0: one who does not look on each other.
